radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder is mildly distended and contains sludge and stone. The gallbladder wall is thickened to 5 mm. The hepatic parenchyma appears within normal limits. There is no focal liver mass. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. There is no ascites. There is no intrahepatic biliary dilation. The CHD measures 8 mm. The pancreas is partially obscured by bowel gas.
